caption: Top notch service and wine— that feels almost too good for DC. The food was beautiful and innovative but not as amazing. The best dishes were the salads my table shared—the beets and carrots were outstanding, as strange as that sounds. I would only go back for restaurant week or special group occasions.
Good food...good service!!
Delicious, especially the oysters and the Peruvian server
Great experience!
Amazing experience all around. Don't skip desert!

All I can say, is that this was fine, but nothing special. Not worth the price tag.  The best thing they had going on a Saturday evening was indoor dining available for our party of 4 - especially without a reservation.  They weren’t eager to have us, and/or they seemed genuinely surprised that anyone would show up with out a reservation?! (Our friend just moved in a block away and we thought we would try this restaurant as our new “local go-to.”) They tripped all over themselves, literally 3 staff member fussing over our party of four, in the very small entryway, as another couple arrived (who had an rsvp)... each of the 3 staff asked me if we had an rsvp and how large our party was and if we were all there. It was just an odd “welcome.”  I got the impression that they were actually hoping we would turn and walk out, but we didn’t, so after about 4-5 minutes of this keystone cops welcoming dance, they managed to find us a table. It was a large table set for 6, just inside and up three steps - and in the breeze every time the front door opened. But hey, this is what we get without any reservation - that part of the evening is on me!  The bread was made in house (I think) and it was delicious!  We ordered a variety of items: steak tartar, pasta with duck, scallops and steak. I had the steak and it was very disappointing for $38 - nothing wrong, but it was oversold on the menu, as tri-tip and sirloin. It was about a 4 Oz cut of tri-tip and two small slices (maybe 2 Oz each) of beef loin. Nothing fancy, nothing special.  They had a great wine list and wines by the glass for $12-18. I had a nitro stout and it was delightful, despite the $9 price tag.  The dessert selections were good and the ladies enjoyed them.  The food was fine - a bit overpriced and the staff took themselves a bit too seriously - or perhaps I did, but I just never felt that we or our business was really welcome.  Lastly, the water in the restroom was so cold I couldn’t wash  my hands... it was probably 35 degrees. Not good esp during covid.
Environment is same as their name ! Food quality is awesome !

Our second visit to Annabelle did not disappoint. Their service is extremely attentive - wine and food recommendations at the ready. Dishes are both familiar as well as incentive - scallops cooked perfectly with chiles and grits recalls a more traditional shrimp and grits offering, while feeling more refined. Can't wait to return.
One of the best restaurants in the city. Big gnocci energy.
Do not go during restaurant week they will give you zero food but a lot of water
Beautiful restaurant, the service is impeccable. Food is fine  I might try again when they offer full menu.
Amazing food and service. Great options for indoor and outdoor.
Delicious, creative dishes and excellent service!
Great restaurant

We dined here for our anniversary. We sat outside by the garden and unfortunately was attacked by the bugs most of the night. Towards the end of our dinner, a staff member offered us a can of bug spray but by then it was too late. Service was a mix. The water staff consistently refilled our glass but our bread plates and other plates were slow to clear. The food we had was mostly pretty good. From what I remember we had: Skate wing and octopus with roasted tomatoes Cooked perfectly. Peach gazpacho with shrimp Very refreshing. Yukon Gold Potato Gnocchi - Locally Foraged Hen of the Woods Mushrooms, Buffalo Milk Butter, Pecorino Cheese It was very light and pillowy. Roasted Shenandoah Lamb Loin -Red Kuri Squash braised with Saffron and Lamb Confit, Kale Buds Very mild and delicious dish specially the lamb confit. Crispy Rice Cakes -with Lime Crema and Oven-Dried Tomatoes Interesting dish. Like rice fries. Chocolate caramel dessert pretty chocolaty and not too sweet.
Friendly staff, excellent food (we had the swordfish and lamb), great wine selections, and sophisticated ambiance. Perfect spot for a date or intimate meal with a friend.
Nice place
Totally enjoyable. Great food and service. Top Notch.

Hands down, the best dining experience I've had in quite some time. The ambiance, the service, the quality of cocktails, wine and food were second to none. This is now my favorite restaurant in DC and I cannot wait to go back again and again. I have never been so impressed by such amazing hospitality. This place is a MUST.

Lovely restaurant. Food was very good and the wine pairing was a bonus. Loved the upper dining room. Staff was very nice and knowledgeable and made us feel very welcomed. Definitely will come back to eat here again.
Enjoyed the ambiance and the servers were friendly. The food was satisfying but not impressive.
Did take out for restraint week during COVID.  The food was very good. Ground steak was a bit over done but everything else was near perfect (for takeout). Cannot wait to revisit in person.
Everything was incredible! So glad to see a new place in this beautiful spot. The corn ravioli was one of my favorite dishes I’ve ever eaten - will be back soon!

Tiny portions for the money and not executed to anywhere near a standard that would justify the price. We just did takeout and the pickup was smooth but, starting with peering into the bag and wondering why there was so little pasta in the top container, it went downhill. The bass crudo was excellent and only a tad on the small side for the $16 price. The two pastas were not listed on the menu as primo piatti; there was no indication of how small they would be or we wouldn't have ordered for $26 each. The sweet corn and pork belly ravioli, as the picture demonstrates, was a tiny portion - 5 2-bite ravioli and 3 measly slivers of pork belly, with nice flavor blown out by way too much salt. The lobster roe and egg pappardelle with a tiny amount of crab meat was small and confusing - the flavors didn't come together, especially the random size pieces of beans, which added a weird textural element. A squeeze of lemon from our fridge helped a little, but not enough - this dish needs to be rebuilt with more acid, possibly cherry tomatoes instead of beans. We failed to see evidence of James Beard caliber talent, and were left hungry and disappointed. With so many other fantastic Italian and new American places within half a mile (not to mention Persian, Korean,  etc), there are much better choices where your money will go farther for both quality and quantity. We tried to come up with a reason to go back, including the interesting restaurant week menu, and couldn't come up with anything compelling. Also, would recommend throwing in a piece of courtesy bread with takeout orders.
Amazing staff, food, and atmosphere! Highly recommend this adorable restaurant. One our favorite spots in DC.
Delicious, innovative food from unique, fresh ingredients. We loved the heirloom tomatoes, oysters, halibut with chanterelles, and summer corn ravioli with truffles 💕
Awesome experience... food, service, everything. Will absolutely be back

The potato gnocchi was light and had a sublime pesto sauce along with mouth watering braised tomatoes accompanied by whole pine nuts and basil. The halibut with chanterelles had flavorings including lavender and lime, and was delicious. The pappardelle had good texture in spite of the carryout travel and was flavorful but with a touch too much heat for me. Annabelle surpassed my expectations.

We ordered two chicken dinners. When we got home my wife said the tasted funny and that the chicken had not been cooked enough. She ate only a few bites but I was hungry and ate some. Within a few hours I became violently ill and remained that way through out the nite. Obviously food poisoning and the restaurant should be very carefu in the future

Terrible experience with order cancelked one half hour after it was to be delivered. No reason given. Manager insisted they didnt cancel but didnt say food was waiting there  to be picked up. Iffered the same order for the next day however what good was that? Also said he would be in touch to explain the next day. That didnt happen either.
Used skiptheline to deliver beyond the caviar limit to BETHESDA. Such a treat to have annabelle/chef ruta’s food during this time.

Annabelle is working overtime to make sure DC can enjoy their wonderful food, albeit in take away form. So what if you have to plate it!  We enjoyed three treats: the delicious cod cake ensemble, the Annabelle salad, and a spectacular pasta dish.  Drop by, say hello to the staff and walk away with a wonderful meal.

Food was very tasty even though there were a few vegetarian options. Nice ambiance and very friendly staff. Mushroom soup was excellent. Enjoyed a nice bottle of Bordeaux, unfortunately can't remember the name.
A perfect trifecta...food, service, ambiance fantastic! Highly recommend a dining experience at Annabelle.
Duck was delicious. Gnocchi was good, but a little rich. Salmon was cooked perfectly and beet salad was also good. Service was impeccable.

My boyfriend and I dined at Annabelle on their two week anniversary.  The hostess was very helpful and even suggested some dishes to try while we waited to be seated.  The waiter and trainee were both very attentive throughout.  We ordered the duck confit carbonara and gnocchi which were both cooked perfectly.  For mains we ordered the salmon and lamb both which were beautifully plated and delicious.  The desserts also did not disappoint.  The roasted pineapple pavlova was my fave but the goat cheese cheesecake was also decadent.  We tried a few cocktails which were also nicely balanced as far as flavors.  There were a few hiccups with service but the wait staff and manager apologized and compensated us for the delay.  I look forward to returning to Annabelle again soon!

Amazing food in a beautiful atmosphere! Ate here last week and absolutely loved it. The drinks are great and the food is outstanding; perfect nice date spot. Our favorite dishes were the duck confit carbonara and the gnocchi. Would absolutely eat there again, as I can only imagine it getting better and better. My only caution is the bar upfront is not giant given the space, so it can be tough to get a drink there before dinner.

First, I must say that we went on the third night Annabelle was open but must rate it off our experience.  The hostess was charming and accommodating to our walk in status and had a place for us at a table by the bar.  Where we were then forgotten.  The pleasant but not very helpful server was slow to take our drink order and then must have forgotten to submit our dinner order.  We both had salads to start, mine was very good, the other salad, Monte Cristo was not very exciting.  I then had the cod which was absolutely amazing and my dinner partner had the duck which was “good “.  Problem is that no one explained about ordering sides so you don’t go home hungry.  We waited about 1/2 hour or longer before someone offered bread when our server told the bread person we had already had bread.  The hostess did notice we had been waiting a long time for dinner and a manger did come to apologize.  We would have had dessert but felt we had been there forever by the time the dessert menu came.  Though I was pleased with the amazing cod, my dinner partner went home and ate a second dinner.  I do hope these wrinkles are ironed out as the space is beautiful and I am sure more good things to try on the menu.  We will go back and try again- in a while.

First look:  Annabelle promises to be an exciting addition to the Kalorama and Dupont neighborhoods. Walk in the front door and be greeted by a gorgeous bar glowing in golden light. The space is cozy, but the ceilings appear taller than they are thanks to great lighting, beautiful bottle displays, and sculptures in the nooks and crannies. Up a small set of stairs are two main dining rooms, which we only saw briefly. Decorated in jewel tones, they seemed polished enough for a business meal, but comfortable enough for a gathering of friends. The place feels "establishment" without sacrificing style and character.  We enjoyed dinner from the more intimate garden room, a small space that was perhaps the least visually interesting but quite calming, especially with leafy vines descending from just below the glass ceiling. Over pauses in dinner conversations, you could hear other patrons talking about the neighborhood. It's clear that locals will enjoy having a place of their own.  But most importantly, the food was excellent! Highlights included gnocchi with blue cheese and pear, the duck and pork entrees, and the goat cheese cheesecake with fruity sorbet. The pork dish creatively combined both shoulder pot roast and loin portions, and the duck's crispy skin was delightful.  We appreciated the quiet but friendly service, which included a helpful recommendation from the head of the wine program.  Welcome to the neighborhood, Annabelle! We look forward to revisiting when we have a cause to celebrate, and in the meantime we eagerly await the release of the more casual bar menu.
